byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and MANNY FERNANDEZ

abstract: Transition team for Pres-elect Donald J Trump is consulting with federal border agents in Texas about construction of new barriers along Mexico border; some local officials feel huge wall that became Trump's signature campaign promise could damage close economic ties between cities on either side of border and would prefer fences be installed.
lead_paragraph: His transition team has asked border officials for advice on where a barrier can be built, though the plan may involve fencing, a Texas congressman says.
snippet: His transition team has asked border officials for advice on where a barrier can be built, though the plan may involve fencing, a Texas congressman says....

headline.main: Trump Seeks Path for Mexico Barrier. But Will It Be a ‘Big, Beautiful Wall’?
headline.print_headline: Seeking a Path for a Mexico Barrier
